The Feel at the Wheel

Colour Grading   Cinematography   

A short comedy commissioned by the Doric Film Festival, directed by Alec Westwood. The 9min film was shot in a single day on a bus in a remote location. Initially imagined as a stage play, it tells the story of a cheeky Aberdonian bus driver and his interactions with the passengers.

Trailer

Colour Grading

From early-on, the black-and-white look of "The Feel at the Wheel" was decided upon, which allowed us to spend some time preparing the look in pre-production. I created a LUT for on-set monitoring, which helped guide the cinematography, and saved us precious minutes on a tight schedule and under difficult lighting conditions.
